newsitem.title: UK: Allied Domecq down after Guinness placing.
newsitem.headline: Allied Domecq down after Guinness placing.

text.p: Shares in drinks and retail group Allied Domecq Plc fell on Friday as some investors sold stock to take up a placement of Guinness shares, dealers said.
They said Goldman Sachs was placing around 135 million Guinness shares on behalf on LVMH, and some investors were selling shares in Allied Domecq to buy Guinness stock.
By 1136 GMT, shares in Allied Domecq were six pence lower at 411-1/2 on volume of 5.7 million.
"People have been selling Allied Domecq to take up the Guinness placing," one market maker said.

LVMH, a French luxury goods group, said it had cut its stake in Guinness from 21 percent to around 14 percent through the placing. Dealers said Goldman Sachs had placed the shares in the market at a price of 414p.
